DOC.HEADLINE: ECHO OF YESTERDAY WINS FEATURE RACE
DOC.TEXT: Echo of Yesterday , ridden by Chris McCarron , won a stretch duel with favored Bossanova to capture the $ 66 # 100 feature race at Santa Anita on Thursday . Echo of Yesterday , the second choice in the wagering , finished a half-length in front of Bossanova , ridden by Eddie Delahoussaye . His Legacy was third , another 1 1 / 4 lengths behind in the one-mile race for 4-year-olds and up . The race was scheduled for the turf , but was switched to the main track because of rain . Echo of Yesterday , a 5-year-old gelded son of Pirate ' s Bounty , carried 115 pounds and was clocked_in 1:34 . Echo of Yesterday paid $ 7.20 , $ 3.20 and $ 2.60. Bossanova , who carried 115 , returned $ 3.20 and $ 2.40. His Legacy , ridden by Alex Solis and carrying 114 , paid $ 2.80. Eight California-bred runners contested the race . Echo of Yesterday , trained by Ron Ellis , has won seven of 12 career races .
